title: Compiler panic on any cargo run/build

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
### Code https://github.com/aalouaoui/nannou-bezier-curves ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01) binary: rustc commit-hash: 59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35 commit-date: 2021-11-01 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.1 LLVM version: 13.0.0 ``` ### Error output ``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` left: `crate25`, right: `crate20`', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/encoder.rs:1724:17 note: run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` environment variable to display a backtrace error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: could not compile `gpu-descriptor` warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... error: build failed ```
Backtrace

``` error[E0463]: can't find crate for `num_traits` which `rusttype` depends on --> /home/khalid/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/rusttype-0.7.9/src/lib.rs:91:9 | 91 | pub use rusttype_next::*; | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^ can't find crate For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0463`. error: could not compile `rusttype` due to previous error warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish... thread 'rustc' panicked at 'assertion failed: `(left == right)` left: `crate23`, right: `crate22`', compiler/rustc_metadata/src/rmeta/encoder.rs:1724:17 stack backtrace: 0: rust_begin_unwind at /rustc/59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35/library/std/src/panicking.rs:517:5 1: core::panicking::panic_fmt at /rustc/59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35/library/core/src/panicking.rs:101:14 2: core::panicking::assert_failed_inner 3: core::panicking::assert_failed 4: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::EncodeContext::encode_crate_root 5: rustc_metadata::rmeta::encoder::encode_metadata_impl 6: rustc_data_structures::sync::join 7: rustc_metadata::rmeta::decoder::cstore_impl::::encode_metadata 8: rustc_middle::ty::context::TyCtxt::encode_metadata 9: rustc_interface::queries::Queries::ongoing_codegen 10: rustc_interface::queries::::enter 11: rustc_span::with_source_map 12: scoped_tls::ScopedKey::set note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace. error: internal compiler error: unexpected panic note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -C opt-level=3 -C embed-bitcode=no --crate-type lib note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden query stack during panic: end of query stack error: build failed ```

### System Info ``` OS: Arch Linux x86_64 Kernel: 5.15.2-arch1-1 CPU: Intel i5-6200U (4) @ 2.800GHz GPU: Intel Skylake GT2 [HD Graphics 520] Memory: 12GB ```
